longDef.en: the group of people together in one place to watch or listen to a play, film, someone speaking, etc.

examples.en: She lectures to audiences all over the world.
examples.cn: 她向世界各地的听众发表演讲。

examples.en: The secret to public speaking is to get the audience on your side.
examples.cn: 当众演讲的秘诀是，一定要让听众支持你的观点。

examples.en: The audience was/were clearly delighted with the performance.
examples.cn: 无疑，观众非常喜欢这场演出。

examples.en: The magic show had a lot of audience participation, with people shouting things to the performers and going up on stage.
examples.cn: 这场魔术表演有很多观众参与的内容，有的观众在台下大声应答表演者，有的则上台助阵。

longDef.en: the (number of) people watching or listening to a particular television or radio programme, reading a particular book, or visiting a particular website
longDef.cn: 观众人数；听众人数；读者人数

examples.en: The television company has lost a large part of its audience since it changed its programming.
examples.cn: 该电视台调整节目后失去了大批观众。

examples.en: Her latest book should appeal to a large audience (= many people will want to read it).
examples.cn: 她的新书应会吸引大批的读者。

longDef.en: a formal meeting that you have with an important person

examples.en: She had a private audience with the king.
examples.cn: 她受到国王的私下召见。
